result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Ladel Evans Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Good time and 9 days credit. First month straight time, remainder at the day reporting center.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
Provide a DNA sample.
As a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine Ladel Evans Sr

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with good time and 9 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  First month straight time, remainder at the day reporting center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Jermaine Ladel Evans in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference, however parties wish to proceed with plea and sentencing instead.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol (post-rotation).  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.

Defendant Jermaine Ladel Evans in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Defense requested a substitution.  Defense still needs discovery. If defense has discovery by the next court date, all motinos should be filed by then. Case adjourned. Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jermaine Ladel Evans in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 7/6/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Supplemental Order setting Forth Conditions of Defendant's Release, for no drugs, no drug paraphernalia or no weapons, signed and filed.

Defendant Jermaine Ladel Evans in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Jermaine Ladel Evans in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jermaine Ladel Evans Sr
Current: 4112 N 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 06-29-2015)
Prior: 1017 West Burleigh Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jermaine Ladel Evans not in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
